intro: Pingraea cymosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Pingraea cymosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and naturalized areas.
